qas.question: Which far away cities in other countries could feel the earthquake?
What was the focal depth of the earthquake?
How long after the earthquake were aftershocks felt?
What is another name for the earthquake in Sichuan?
Where was the epicenter of the earthquake?
How far was it from Chengdu?
What was the focal depth of the quake?

context: It is also known as <a3_0>the Wenchuan earthquake<a3_0/> (Chinese: 汶川大地震; pinyin: Wènchuān dà dìzhèn; literally: "Great Wenchuan earthquake"), after the location of the earthquake's epicenter, <a4_0>Wenchuan County, Sichuan<a4_0/>. The epicenter was <a5_0>80 kilometres<a5_0/> (50 mi) west-northwest of Chengdu, the provincial capital, with a focal depth of <a1_0><a6_0>19 km<a6_0/><a1_0/> (12 mi). The earthquake was also felt in nearby countries and as far away as both <a0_0>Beijing and Shanghai<a0_0/>—1,500 km (930 mi) and 1,700 km (1,060 mi) away—where office buildings swayed with the tremor. Strong aftershocks, some exceeding magnitude 6, continued to hit the area even <a2_0>months after<a2_0/> the main quake, causing new casualties and damage.
